be.kuleuven.socialmap.database
Interface Database<T>

Type Parameters:
T - The model class whose objects the implementing Database class will save, retrieve, ... to/from the database.
All Known Implementing Classes:
FlickrMongoDatabase, FsVenueMongoDatabase, MapReduceResultMongoDatabase, TwitterMongoDatabase
public interface Database<T>

Every class representing a database should implement this interface. The preferred way of accessing a Database class is through the DatabaseFactory.

Method Summary
 java.util.List<T> getAll()
          Returns all the elements in this database.
 T getOne(java.lang.Object id)
          Returns the element with the specified id in the database, or null if it doesn't exist.
 boolean insert(T element)
          Insert an element in the database.
 boolean remove(T element)
          Removes an element from the database.
 boolean update(T element)
          Updates an element in the database.
 

Method Detail

getAll

java.util.List<T> getAll()
Returns all the elements in this database. If there are no elements the list will be empty.

Returns:
all the elements in this database

getOne

T getOne(java.lang.Object id)
Returns the element with the specified id in the database, or null if it doesn't exist.

Parameters:
id - the id of the element to return
Returns:
the element with the specified id in the database

update

boolean update(T element)
Updates an element in the database. The element which will be updated, is based on the id of the specified element.

Parameters:
element - the updated element you wish to update in the database
Returns:
true if the update succeeded, false otherwise

insert

boolean insert(T element)
Insert an element in the database.

Parameters:
element - the element that will inserted in the database
Returns:
true if the insert succeeded, false otherwise

remove

boolean remove(T element)
Removes an element from the database.

Parameters:
element - the element that will removed from the database
Returns:
true if the element was successfully removed, false otherwise
